definition: light-years (apart)/a million miles (apart)/(i.e. indicates a huge difference or a huge distance)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: To refer to a toilet as a “rest room” is miles apart from the Chinese idea of a toilet.
sentences.chinese: “休息室”与中文厕所的概念相距十万八千里。

sentences.english: And I think there is a hell-a-lot of difference in training and fighting.
sentences.chinese: 还有我认为训练和打仗是差得十万八千里。

sentences.english: The reality is far from what they boast.
sentences.chinese: 现实与他们吹嘘的相差何止十万八千里。

sentences.english: It seemed to him that he was already at an immense distance from life.
sentences.chinese: 他仿佛觉得他已阔别人生十万八千里。

definition: inferior/not up to par/to fall far short/to be mistaken
lit. as different as sky and earth (idiom)/fig. night and day difference/opposite extremes/a world of difference/a far cry from
just the tiniest bit/a hint of
as different as heaven and earth (idiom)/worlds apart
to act in a way that defeats one's purpose (idiom)
accurate to perfection (idiom)/precise to the finest detail
lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: fall short by a large amount
